intro: Hieracium amideii, commonly known as the Amidei hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to Europe and is characterized by its upright growth habit and yellow-orange flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun. It has basal and stem leaves that are usually hairy and serrated. Hieracium amideii is an annual or biennial plant, known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
